title: Data Engineer
description: <strong>Summary</strong><p><br></p>The Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) measures labor market activity, working conditions, price changes, and productivity in the U.S. economy to support public and private decision making.<p><br></p>This is an appointment under the DOL Recent Graduates program. The program duration is one year. Upon successful completion of the program and at the agency's discretion, the appointee may be converted to a term or permanent position in the competitive service.<p><br></p>Learn more about this agency<p><br></p>Help <strong>Duties</strong><p><br></p><em>Duties include but are not limited to:</em><p><br></p><ul><li>The incumbent plans, schedules, and conducts data collection assignments using fairly complex economic or statistical techniques which are covered by established methods and procedures. Work requires some adaptation of established procedures, the recognition of the significance of variations, and interpretation of limited findings.</li><li>Makes arrangements preparatory to obtaining voluntary data from enterprises for which the collection of data is expected to present relatively few complexities and for which precedents exist. Applies standard practices and techniques to the solicitation of data and reports information in accordance with survey requirements.</li><li>Evaluates the data collected and makes adjustments or follow-up contact with respondents to ensure reliability and comparability as well as reasonableness and conformance to survey requirements.</li><li>Critically evaluate collection experience in relations to survey design and specifications, survey materials, economic conditions affection the industry and area studied, and trends in the industry and area. Recommends modifications in survey methods oriented toward improvements in the survey plan.</li></ul> <em>Duties at the GS-07/09 are development leading up to the full performance level of the GS-12</em><p><br></p>Help <strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p>Conditions of Employment<p><br></p><ul><li>Must be at least 16 years.</li><li>Must be a U.S. Citizen.</li><li>Candidate required to obtain the necessary security/investigation level.</li><li>Requires a probationary period if the requirement has not been met.</li><li>Requires a valid driver's license.</li><li>Appointees must sign a DOL Pathways Recent Graduate Program Participant Agreement.</li><li>The entire duration of the Recent Graduate Appointment constitutes a trial period.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p>Applicants must meet the <strong>Basic Requirements</strong> and the <strong>minimum qualifications</strong> to qualify for each grade they wish to be considered for.<p><br></p><strong>This is an interdisciplinary position and can be filled either as an Economist (0110 series) or as a Statistician (Economics) (1530 series).</strong><p><br></p><strong>Basic Requirement:</strong><p><br></p><em><strong>Economist, GS-0110:</strong> </em>A) Degree in economics, that included at least 21 semester hours in economics and 3 semester hours in statistics, accounting or calculus. <em><strong>OR</strong> </em>B) A combination of education and experience - courses equivalent to a major in economics, as shown in A above, plus appropriate experience or additional education.<p><br></p><em><strong>Statistician (Economics), GS-1530:</strong> </em>A) Degree that included 15 semester hours in statistics (or in mathematics and statistics, provided at least 6 semester hours were in statistics), and 9 additional semester hours in one or more of the following: physical or biological sciences, medicine, education, or engineering; or in the social sciences including demography, history, economics, social welfare, geography, international relations, social or cultural anthropology, health sociology, political science, public administration, psychology, etc. Credit toward meeting statistical course requirements should be given for courses in which 50 percent of the course content appears to be statistical methods, e.g., courses that included studies in research methods in psychology or economics such as tests and measurements or business cycles, or courses in methods of processing mass statistical data such as tabulating methods or electronic data processing. <em><strong>OR</strong> </em>B) A combination of education and experience - courses as shown in A above, plus appropriate experience or additional education. The experience should have included a full range of professional statistical work such as (a) sampling, (b)collecting, computing, and analyzing statistical data, and (c) applying statistical techniques such as measurement of central tendency, dispersion, skewness, sampling error, simple and multiple correlation, analysis of variance, and tests of significance.<p><br></p><strong>In addition to meeting the Basic Requirement above, applicants must also meet the minimum qualifications to be considered:</strong><p><br></p><strong>Specialized Experience:</strong><p><br></p><strong>GS-7</strong>: One (1) year of specialized experience equivalent to GS-5.<p><br></p><strong>GS-9</strong>: One (1) year of specialized experience equivalent to GS-7.<p><br></p>Specialized experience should include a thorough range of complex economic professional work. Some examples of qualifying specialized experience include:<p><br></p><strong>GS-7</strong>: <em>Planned, scheduled, and collected economic data from assigned companies and industries; Collected data via personal visits, video collaboration tools, phone, and or/email; Written up collected data into software for review and transmittal.</em><p><br></p><strong>GS-9</strong>: <em>Contacted sampled establishments to schedule appointments and conduct interviews; Secured voluntary cooperation and interviewed company officials to collect data from business for timely survey results; Made follow up contact to respondents for necessary clarifications to ensure accuracy of data provided. </em><p><br></p><em>OR</em><p><br></p><strong>Education Substitution:</strong><p><br></p><strong>GS-7</strong>: 1 year of graduate-level education <em>or </em>superior academic achievement. description: <strong>About ONE<br><br></strong>ONE is on a mission to help people live healthier financial lives. We’re doing this by creating simple solutions to help our customers save, spend, and grow their money – all in one place.<br><br>The U.S. consumer today deserves better. Millions of Americans today can’t access credit, build savings or wealth, and are left to manage their financial lives through multiple disconnected apps. Almost a quarter of U.S. adults are unbanked or underbanked and roughly 80% of fintech users rely on multiple accounts to manage their finances.<br><br>What makes us unique? We are backed by a preeminent fintech investor (Ribbit) and the world’s largest retailer (Walmart), maintain the speed and independence of a startup, and employ a strong (and growing) collection of world-class talent.<br><br>There’s never been a better moment to build a business that helps people live healthier financial lives. Come build with us!<br><br><strong>The role<br><br></strong>As a Strategic Risk Implementation Process Engineer your mandate is to architect and implement the credit, fraud and compliance (risk) strategies into a low-code/no-code platform which will power the onboarding and account management experience for all ONE users. In this role, you will collaborate with business, operations, product and engineering teams to understand the intent and design solutions that are resilient, scalable, and forward looking. Finally, you will assist in BAU and performance testing, as well as platform performance optimization to ensure we are meeting the business SLAs and SLOs. This role reports to Manager, Risk Platform.<br><br>This role is responsible for:<br><ul><li>Architecting strategies for implementation of complex end-to-end business processes in a low-code environment</li><li>Designing custom technology solutions for specific business outcomes</li><li>Implementing business logic such as rules, models, features and scorecards</li><li>Integrating with 3rd party data vendor APIs and map data to business processes</li><li>Assisting with design of product interface and associated APIs schemas</li><li>Designing and executing unit and integration tests<br><br></li></ul><strong>You bring<br></strong><ul><li>Minimum 2 yrs of relevant experience </li><li>An act-like-an-owner mentality. We have a bias toward taking action.</li><li>Understanding of software development best practices</li><li>Experience with programming languages such as SQL, Python, Javascript</li><li>Ability or prior experience with workflow design, business process modeling </li><li>Familiarity with RESTful APIs and tools like Postman</li><li>Experience using JIRA or similar project tracking software</li><li>Self-starter with a can-do attitude who is interested in making 1+1=3 (adding value above and beyond the requirements on paper)</li><li>Someone who is interested in understanding the WHY behind their work</li><li>Familiarity with credit, fraud, risk, or compliance systems and/or strategies a plus</li><li>Experience working with low-code platforms is a plus</li><li>Experience working with onboarding or transaction decision engines in financial services, insurtech, or ecommerce company is a plus<br><br></li></ul><strong>Pay Transparency<br><br></strong>The estimated annual base salary for this position ranges from $135,000 to $150,000. Pay is generally based upon the level, complexity, responsibility, and job duties/requirements of the specific position. We then source candidates with the requisite skills, expertise, education, training, and experience. If you are selected for an interview, please feel welcome to speak to a Talent Partner about our compensation philosophy and other available benefits.<br><br>What it’s like working @ ONE<br><br>Our teams collaborate remotely and in our work spaces in New York and Sacramento.<br><ul><li>Competitive cash - we don’t discount based on location</li><li>Benefits effective on day one </li><li>Early access to a high potential, high growth fintech</li><li>Generous stock option packages in an early-stage startup</li><li>Remote friendly (anywhere in the US) and office friendly - you pick the schedule</li><li>Flexible time off programs - vacation, sick, paid parental leave, and paid caregiver leave</li><li>401(k) plan with match<br><br></li></ul>Leveling Philosophy<br><br>In order to thoughtfully scale the company and avoid downstream inequities, we’ve adopted a flat titling structure at ONE. Though we may occasionally post a role externally with a prefix such as “Senior” to reflect the external level of the position, we do not use prefixes in titles like that internally unless in a position which manages a team. Internal titles typically include your specific functional responsibility, such as engineering, product management or sales, and often include additional descriptors to ensure clarity of role and placement within our organization (i.e. “Engineer, Platform”, “Sales, Business Development” or “Manager, Talent”). Employees are paid commensurate with their experience and the internal level within ONE.<br><br>Inclusion &amp; Belonging<br><br>To build technology and products that are used and loved by people and solve real-world problems, we need to build a team with many different perspectives and experiences. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us. Email talent@one.app with any questions.<br><br>For additional questions around our interview process, please check out our Candidate FAQs.

description: Methode Electronics is seeking an<strong> Associate </strong><strong>Business Analyst </strong>to join our Corporate IT team. You will assist in writing documentation, conducting research, analyzing data, providing first-level support to our helpdesk customers, and making recommendations to improve effectiveness and efficiency. We are seeking candidates who want to start on the ground level and advance as knowledge is gained in a mentored position.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Support EDI customer onboarding, security management, helpdesk management</li><li>Help plan and design work instructions and make recommendations for improvement</li><li>Perform research and analysis in support of operations</li><li>Assist in resolving business issues using systems and data</li><li>Perform level one helpdesk support, including password resets, ticket assignments, submitting tickets for approval, for CMS requests</li><li>Help launch new initiatives and projects</li><li>Monitor systems for outages and alerts</li><li>Other duties as assigned</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Management Information Systems, or related major required</li><li>Prior internship in IT preferred</li><li>Experience with Microsoft Office</li><li>Excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills</li><li>Good written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Strong work ethic and attention to detail</li><li>Detail-oriented with strong organizational skills</li><li>Ability to occasionally carry and lift up to 15 pounds </li></ul><p><br></p>Methode Electronics is an equal opportunity employer. description: <strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Metra is one of the largest and most complex commuter rail systems in North America, serving Cook, DuPage, Will, Lake, Kane, and McHenry Counties. The agency is linking communities in Northeastern Illinois by providing safe, reliable, and efficient commuter service.<p><br></p>Engineering is responsible for building and maintaining the majority of Metra’s fixed assets, such as buildings, stations, bridges, track, electrical, telecommunications and signal systems. The Engineering Department also monitors the condition of and assists in building and maintaining the fixed assets on the freight lines where Metra trains operate. The Engineering Department is divided into two major groups: Capital Projects, and Communications and Maintenance.<p><br></p>Reporting to the Manager, PTC Engineering, the PTC Systems Engineer 2 supports the long term operations of the PTC system through troubleshooting and monitoring of the system, conducting Tier 2 analysis of PTC events and issues, and responding to end-user calls, and documenting events and issues in the PTC ticketing system.<p><br></p>The Primary Duties include: Provide support and assist personnel experiencing issues with the system including initializing equipment on-board trains, installing wayside software and equipment, and creating bulletins and train IDs.<p><br></p>Analyze and clearly, concisely, and accurately document situations, events, and issues of the system.<p><br></p>Perform root cause analysis of events and issues and make recommendations to prevent future occurrences.<p><br></p>Work with other departments to improve operational support, trouble shooting methodologies, and documentation processes to decrease delays and increase system performance.<p><br></p>Utilize best practices for configuration management and quality assurance in maintaining the system.<p><br></p>This position is subject to random drug and/or alcohol testing.<p><br></p><strong>Candidates can expect salary offers that range from <u>the minimum to the mid-point</u> of the salary range.</strong> Metra provides full pay ranges so candidate can consider their growth potential.<p><br></p>Metra is a railroad employer subject to the provisions of the Railroad Retirement Tax Act, not the Social Security Administration.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's degree or in lieu of degree, a combination of education and experience that equals four years in Information Technology or Engineering with an emphasis on system testing, maintenance, or root cause analysis.</li><li> In addition to #1, must have three years experience in a technical help desk or end user support facility with focus on Tier 2 and root cause analysis of digital components and systems.</li><li> Good knowledge of:</li><li>software, computers, operating systems (Red Hat enterprise Linux, Microsoft), data communications transports, data security, and networking technologies.</li><li>the root cause analysis process. </li><li> Good:</li><li>verbal and written communication skills. </li><li>problem solving, analytical, and organizational skills. </li><li> Skill navigating enterprise applications.</li><li> Ability to:</li><li>work well with employees at all levels of the organization as well as contractors. </li><li>apply analytical decision-making principles in resolving systems problems. </li><li>work in a fast-paced environment.</li><li> Must:</li><li>be proficient in Microsoft 365. </li><li>possess and maintain a valid driver's license and be able to operate a vehicle.</li><li>be available to work flexible hours in the early morning, late afternoon, evenings, or weekends.</li><li> Willing to work occasional Holidays.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferences</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience working in the transportation industry.</li></ul><p><br></p>On May 11, 2023, both the state of IL and the federal government will put an end to the COVID-19 emergency measures. Effective May 11, 2023, Metra's COVID vaccine requirements will be suspended until further notice.<p><br></p>Please note: Regardless of any state laws that legalize marijuana, Metra prohibits applicants and employees’ use or possession of marijuana (or marijuana paraphernalia), or having detectable amounts of marijuana in their bodies, including synthetic and/or non-synthetic substances such as THC for any reason for preemployment screening purposes, while on duty, subject to duty, on Metra property, or in Metra work equipment and vehicles.<p><br></p>Metra is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. It is our policy to fill vacant positions with qualified candidates without regard to race, color, sex, religion, national origin, age, gender identity, disability, or any protected categories, assuming an individual can perform the essential functions of the job with or without accommodation.
